data.title: Socceroos great Jason Culina’s new $4m home renovation project
data.meta_description: Former Socceroo turned property developer Jason Culina and his interior designer wife Terri have scored their next house flipping project.
data.text:
Former Socceroo turned property developer Jason Culina and his interior designer wife Terri have secured their next residential home project.

Having a history of successfully flipping projects around Putney, they have instead gone to the Hills.

They have spent $3.85 million on a vast home in Glenhaven, which they intend to renovate.

MORE: Latrell Mitchell’s controversial farm for sale

Byron prices plummet in ‘reverse Hemsworth effect’

The grand English Tudor-style manor was marketed as King of the Hill, being one of the finest houses in the Hills District, by Century 21 The Hills District agents.

Set on 2575 sqm on Binet Way in the Sandhurst Estate, the home was masterbuilt by Binet Homes in the late 1980s.

Spanning two levels, the country-style manor has views to the Blue Mountains.

It has four bedrooms, a study, and a rumpus room with wet bar, fireplace, high ceilings and exposed beams.

Its established gardens have a salt water, gas-heated pool and jet spa and cabana, plus a championship tennis court.

The cul-de-sac home, which has sandstone and brick retaining walls, last traded for $3 million just under two years ago when it was bought by well-known fruit and vegetable wholesaler Murphy Moses.

It was once marketed as Chateau d’Amour, and before that it was known as Arundle Manor.

The Culina couple have flipped houses in Putney over the years, as well as one in Denham Court.

In late 2021 they sold a new build at Putney in a joint venture for $3,575,000, then made the move to the Gold Coast, buying a near-new home in Mermaid Beach for $2,775,000, which they retain.

They sold their revamped Putney home for a tidy profit in 2017 when they wanted $3.2m and secured $3.48m. The home had cost $1.77 million three years earlier.
